Role and Responsibilities: As a Freight Forwarding Specialist, you'll play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth movement of goods across borders.Your responsibilities will include:üåê Collaborating with clients, carriers, and customs officials to coordinate international shipments.üìã Preparing and managing shipping documentation, including bills of lading and customs declarations.üì¶ Selecting the best transportation modes and routes to optimize delivery timelines and costs.üîç Monitoring shipments and addressing any potential delays or issues proactively.üìä Analyzing market trends and rates to secure the most competitive pricing for clients.üíº Providing exceptional customer service by keeping clients informed at every stage of the process.Qualifications:3+ years of Dubai experience in freight forwarding or related logistics roles.
Proficiency in customs regulations, documentation, and international trade.
Strong negotiation skills to secure favorable terms with carriers and vendors.

Skills:
Customs Regulations: In-depth knowledge of international customs regulations, import/export documentation, and compliance requirements.
Shipping Documentation: Proficiency in preparing and managing shipping documents, bills of lading, commercial invoices, and customs declarations.
Transportation Modes: Understanding of different transportation modes (air, sea, road, rail) and their associated logistics processes.
Trade Agreements: Familiarity with trade agreements, tariffs, duties, and taxes that impact cross-border shipments.
Logistics Software: Experience using logistics software and tools for shipment tracking, route optimization, and documentation management.
Negotiation Skills: Ability to negotiate favorable terms with carriers, freight forwarders, and suppliers to ensure cost-effective shipments.

Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills to interact with clients, carriers, customs officials, and internal teams.
Problem-Solving: Skill in addressing challenges that arise during shipping, such as delays, documentation discrepancies, and route changes.
Attention to Detail: Keen eye for accuracy in preparing documentation, recording shipment details, and ensuring compliance.
Time Management: Efficiently manage multiple shipments, deadlines, and prioritize tasks to ensure timely deliveries.
Customer Service: Dedication to providing exceptional customer service, keeping clients informed, and addressing inquiries promptly.
Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changing regulations, market conditions, and client needs in the fast-paced logistics industry.
Analytical Thinking: Capacity to analyze shipping options, costs, and routes to make informed decisions.
Team Collaboration: Collaborate effectively with internal teams, clients, carriers, and partners to achieve seamless operations
